name: 莊澤光
objective: The purpose of this course is to train students to independently plan, analyze, evaluate, summarize, and think creatively through the use of project design. Through an in-depth exploration of life styles, current trends, and technological developments, students will practice the process of project design and become familiar with the knowledge and techniques of integrating design and technology. In this program, students work in groups to complete an integrated media design theme, and finally present their work in both on-campus and off-campus public exhibitions.
schedule:
Week 1 – Initial Project Proposal Presentation & Prototype Continuation

Continue prototype development from the previous semester

Proposal presentation (approx. 10 slides)

Written report (1 page, double-column Word document)

[Design Background & Motivation I]

Internal team milestone: Confirm technical direction and resume prototype building

Week 2–5 – Group Discussion, Development & Early Prototyping

Ongoing group discussions and refinement of concept and functionality

Begin key module implementation and interaction logic testing

Set targets for functional prototype by midterm

Week 6 – Midterm Review II: Visual Aesthetic Confirmation & Interaction Technique Testing

Live demonstration (including early prototype functions)

Three A3 posters

Written report (2 pages, double-column Word document)

[Design Background & Motivation II]

[Design & Implementation I]

Updated exhibition layout plan

Prototype Milestone: Functional prototype completed and demonstrable

Week 7–10 – Iterative Development & Visual-Technical Integration

Continued development on visuals, motion graphics, and technical structure

Integrate UI/UX elements into the prototype

Begin preparing documentation and materials for Midterm III

Week 11 – Midterm Review III: Aesthetic & Technical Integration
(Includes one invited external expert)

Prototype presentation (approx. 10 slides, including video clips of interaction or use cases)

Written report (2 pages, double-column Word document)

[Design Background & Motivation III]

[Design & Implementation II]

Updated exhibition layout plan

Prototype Milestone: Integration of visual and technical elements completed; preparing for final polish

Week 12–17 – Final Preparation, Testing, and Competition Readiness

Final adjustments to visual design, UI/UX, and interactivity

Implement feedback from previous reviews

Package materials for design competition submission (documentation, visual assets, video)

Prototype Milestone: At least 85% completion including all core features, UI, graphics, and interactions

Week 18 – Final Review IV
(Three invited external experts and five advising faculty members)

Final presentation and working prototype demonstration

Five A3 posters

100-second introductory video

Final written report (2 pages, double-column Word document)

[Design Background & Motivation IV]

[Design & Implementation III]

Final exhibition layout plan

Evaluation Methods and Criteria:
Joint Reviews – 70%

Attendance Policy
Students who miss more than six classes without a valid reason and without submitting a leave application through the school system will forfeit all points allocated to their Attendance and Class Participation grade.
